application.name: marcical
application.description:
This program applies a flat-field correction for each framelet based on the band's filter number. In order to output in I/F units, the cube must have spice data. This calibration problem follows the algorithms described the document titled:
Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter Mars Color Imager (MARCI):
Instrument Description, Calibration, and Performance
J.F. Bell III, M.J. Wolff, M.C. Malin, W.M. Calvin, B.A. Cantor, M.A. Caplinger, R.T. Clancy, K.S. Edgett3, L.J. Edwards5, J. Fahle, F. Ghaemi, R.M. Haberle, A. Hale, P.B. James, S.W. Lee, T. McConnochie, E. Noe Dobrea1, M.A. Ravine, D. Schaeffer, K.D. Supulver, and P.C. Thomas

history.change: Fixed a problem where segmentation faults would occur if run with the option "IOF=false"

Added code to obtain exposure times from $mro/calibration/marci/varexp.tab so they can be used when calibrating the input image. Also had to handle images that have been flipped by marci2isis. Fixes #1860.
Fixed a bug in exposure time accounting. Fixes #1860.
Modified to use the exposure duration from the new label keywords added by marci2isis. Related #2034
Implimented step 3 of marci calibration description, where if normalized flatfile DN value is less than 0.25, the output cube DN is set to 0.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: This is the non-flat-field corrected, unprojected MARCI cube

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: This is the flat-field corrected MARCI cube

parameter.name: IOF
parameter.brief: Make the output MARCI image in units of I/F
parameter.description: This makes the output MARCI image in I/F units instead of radiance
